intro: Maytenus mucugensis, commonly known as the Amazonian mayten, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in catkins, followed by small, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. Its bark and leaves have been traditionally used in folk medicine for their potential therapeutic properties.
